91 class Distribution:
92  """
93  Abstract class for all statistical distributions.
94  Due to the large variations of parameters for each distribution, it is
95  unlikely to be able to standardize a parameter list for each method that
96  is meaningful for all distributions. Instead, the parameters to construct
97  each distribution is to be given as keyword arguments.
98 
99  @see: Ling, MHT. 2009. Compendium of Distributions, I: Beta, Binomial, Chi-
100  Square, F, Gamma, Geometric, Poisson, Student's t, and Uniform. The Python
101  Papers Source Codes 1:4
102  """
103 
104  def __init__(self, **parameters):
105  """
106  Constructor method. The parameters are used to construct the
107  probability distribution.
108  """
109  raise NotImplementedError
110 
111  def CDF(self, x):
112  """
113  Cummulative Distribution Function, which gives the cummulative
114  probability (area under the probability curve) from -infinity or 0 to
115  a give x-value on the x-axis where y-axis is the probability. CDF is
116  also known as density function.
117  """
118  raise NotImplementedError
119 
120  def PDF(self, x):
121  """
122  Partial Distribution Function, which gives the probability for the
123  particular value of x, or the area under probability distribution from
124  x-h to x+h for continuous distribution.
125  """
126  raise NotImplementedError
127 
128  def inverseCDF(self, probability, start=0.0, step=0.01):
129  """
130  It does the reverse of CDF() method, it takes a probability value and
131  returns the corresponding value on the x-axis.
132  """
133  raise NotImplementedError
134 
135  def mean(self):
136  """
137  Gives the arithmetic mean of the sample.
138  """
139  raise NotImplementedError
140 
141  def mode(self):
142  """
143  Gives the mode of the sample, if closed-form is available.
144  """
145  raise NotImplementedError
146 
147  def kurtosis(self):
148  """
149  Gives the kurtosis of the sample.
150  """
151  raise NotImplementedError
152 
153  def skew(self):
154  """
155  Gives the skew of the sample.
156  """
157  raise NotImplementedError
158

160  """
161  Gives the variance of the sample.
162  """
163  raise NotImplementedError

169 class BetaDistribution(Distribution):
170  """
171  Class for Beta Distribution.
172 
173  @see: Ling, MHT. 2009. Compendium of Distributions, I: Beta, Binomial, Chi-
174  Square, F, Gamma, Geometric, Poisson, Student's t, and Uniform. The Python
175  Papers Source Codes 1:4
176 
177  @status: Tested method
178  @since: version 0.2
179  """
180 
181  def __init__(self, location, scale, p, q):
182  """
183  Constructor method. The parameters are used to construct the
184  probability distribution.
185 
186  @param location:
187  @param scale: upper bound
188  @param p: shape parameter. Although no upper bound but seldom exceed 10.
189  @param q: shape parameter. Although no upper bound but seldom exceed 10.
190  """
191  self.location = float(location)
192  self.scale = float(scale)
193  self.p = float(p)
194  self.q = float(q)
195 
196  def CDF(self, x):
197  """
198  Cummulative Distribution Function, which gives the cummulative
199  probability (area under the probability curve) from -infinity or 0 to
200  a give x-value on the x-axis where y-axis is the probability.
201  """
202  return nrpy.betai(self.p, self.q, (x - self.location)/
203  (self.scale - self.location))
204 
205  def PDF(self, x):
206  """
207  Partial Distribution Function, which gives the probability
208  for particular value of x, or the area under probability
209  distribution from x-h to x+h for continuous distribution.
210  """
211  n = (self.scale - self.location) ** (self.p + self.q - 1)
212  n = nrpy.gammln(self.p) * nrpy.gammln(self.q) * n
213  n = nrpy.gammln(self.p + self.q) / n
214  p = (x - self.location) ** (self.p - 1)
215  q = (self.scale - x) ** (self.q - 1)
216  return n * p * q
217 
218  def inverseCDF(self, probability, start=0.0, step=0.01):
219  """
220  It does the reverse of CDF() method, it takes a probability
221  value and returns the corresponding value on the x-axis.
222  """
223  cprob = self.CDF(start)
224  if probability < cprob:
225  return (start, cprob)
226  while probability > cprob:
227  start = start + step
228  cprob = self.CDF(start)
229  return (start, cprob)
230 
231  def mean(self):
232  """Gives the arithmetic mean of the sample."""
233  n = (self.location * self.q) + (self.scale * self.p)
234  return n / (self.p + self.q)
235 
236  def mode(self):
237  """Gives the mode of the sample."""
238  n = (self.location * (self.q - 1)) + (self.scale * \
239  (self.p - 1))
240  return n / (self.p + self.q - 2)
241 
242  def kurtosis(self):
243  """Gives the kurtosis of the sample."""
244  n = (self.p ** 2) * (self.q + 2) + \
245  (2 * (self.q ** 2)) + \
246  ((self.p * self.q) * (self.q - 2))
247  n = n * (self.p + self.q + 1)
248  d = self.p * self.q * (self.p + self.q + 2) * \
249  (self.p + self.q + 3)
250  return 3 * ((n / d) - 1)
251 
252  def skew(self):
253  """Gives the skew of the sample."""
254  d = (self.p + self.q) ** 3
255  d = d * (self.p + self.q + 1) * (self.p + self.q + 2)
256  e = ((self.p + self.q) ** 2) * (self.p + self.q + 1)
257  e = (self.p * self.q) / e
258  e = e ** 1.5
259  return ((2 * self.p * self.q) * (self.q - self.q)) / (d * e)
260 
261  def variance(self):
262  """Gives the variance of the sample."""
263  n = self.p * self.q * ((self.scale - self.location) ** 2)
264  d = (self.p + self.q + 1) * ((self.p + self.q) ** 2)
265  return n / d
266 
267  def moment(self, r):
268  """Gives the r-th moment of the sample."""
269  return nrpy.beta(self.p + r,
270  self.q)/nrpy.beta(self.p, self.q)
271 
272  def random(self):
273  """Gives a random number based on the distribution."""
274  return random.betavariate(self.p, self.q)
275 
276 
277 class BinomialDistribution(Distribution):
278  """
279  Class for Binomial Distribution.
280 
281  @see: Ling, MHT. 2009. Compendium of Distributions, I: Beta, Binomial, Chi-
282  Square, F, Gamma, Geometric, Poisson, Student's t, and Uniform. The Python
283  Papers Source Codes 1:4
284 
285  @status: Tested method
286  @since: version 0.2
287  """
288 
289  def __init__(self, success=0.5, trial=1000):
290  """
291  Constructor method. The parameters are used to construct
292  the probability distribution.
293 
294  @param success: probability of success; 0 <= success <= 1
295  @param trial: number of Bernoulli trials
296  """
297  self.success = float(success)
298  self.trial = int(trial)
299 
300  def CDF(self, x):
301  """
302  Cummulative Distribution Function, which gives the cummulative
303  probability (area under the probability curve) from -infinity or 0 to
304  a give x-value on the x-axis where y-axis is the probability.
305  """
306  return nrpy.cdf_binomial(x, self.trial, self.success)
307 
308  def PDF(self, x):
309  """
310  Partial Distribution Function, which gives the probability for the
311  particular value of x, or the area under probability distribution from
312  x-h to x+h for continuous distribution.
313  """
314  x = int(x)
315  return nrpy.bico(self.trial, x) * \
316  (self.success ** x) * \
317  ((1 - self.success) ** (self.trial - x))
318 
319  def inverseCDF(self, probability, start=0, step=1):
320  """
321  It does the reverse of CDF() method, it takes a probability
322  value and returns the corresponding value on the x-axis.
323  """
324  cprob = self.CDF(start)
325  if probability < cprob:
326  return (start, cprob)
327  while probability > cprob:
328  start = start + step
329  cprob = self.CDF(start)
330  return (start, cprob)
331 
332  def mean(self):
333  """Gives the arithmetic mean of the sample."""
334  return self.success * self.trial
335 
336  def mode(self):
337  """Gives the mode of the sample."""
338  return int(self.success * (self.trial + 1))
339 
340  def kurtosis(self):
341  """Gives the kurtosis of the sample."""
342  return (1 - ((6 * self.success * (1 - self.success))) /
343  (self.trial * self.success * (1 - self.success)))
344 
345  def skew(self):
346  """Gives the skew of the sample."""
347  return (1 - self.success - self.success)/ \
348  ((self.trial * self.success * (1 - self.success)) ** 0.5)
349 
350  def variance(self):
351  """Gives the variance of the sample."""
352  return self.mean() * (1 - self.success)
353

355 class CauchyDistribution(Distribution):
356  """
357  Class for Cauchy Distribution.
358 
359  @see: Chen, KFQ, Ling, MHT. 2013. COPADS III (Compendium of
360  Distributions II): Cauchy, Cosine, Exponential, Hypergeometric,
361  Logarithmic, Semicircular, Triangular, and Weibull. The Python
362  Papers Source Codes 5: 2.
363 
364  @status: Tested method
365  @since: version 0.4
366  """
367 
368  def __init__(self, location=0.0, scale=1.0):
369  """
370  Constructor method. The parameters are used to construct the
371  probability distribution.
372 
373  @param location: the mean; default = 0.0
374  @param scale: spread of the distribution, S{lambda}; default = 1.0
375  """
376  self.location = location
377  self.scale = scale
378 
379  def CDF(self, x):
380  """
381  Cummulative Distribution Function, which gives the cummulative
382  probability (area under the probability curve) from -infinity or 0 to
383  a give x-value on the x-axis where y-axis is the probability."""
384  return 0.5 + 1 / PI * math.atan((x - self.location) / self.scale)
385 
386  def PDF(self, x):
387  """
388  Partial Distribution Function, which gives the probability for the
389  particular value of x, or the area under probability distribution from
390  x-h to x+h for continuous distribution."""
391  return 1 / (PI * self.scale * \
392  (1 + (((x - self.location) / self.scale) ** 2)))
393 
394  def inverseCDF(self, probability, start=0.0, step=0.01):
395  """
396  It does the reverse of CDF() method, it takes a probability value and
397  returns the corresponding value on the x-axis."""
398  cprob = self.CDF(start)
399  if probability < cprob: return (start, cprob)
400  while (probability > cprob):
401  start = start + step
402  cprob = self.CDF(start)
403  # print start, cprob
404  return (start, cprob)
405 
406  def mean(self):
407  """Gives the arithmetic mean of the sample."""
408  raise DistributionFunctionError('Mean for Cauchy Distribution is \
409  undefined')
410 
411  def mode(self):
412  """Gives the mode of the sample."""
413  return self.location
414 
415  def median(self):
416  """Gives the median of the sample."""
417  return self.location
418 
419  def quantile1(self):
420  """Gives the 1st quantile of the sample."""
421  return self.location - self.scale
422 
423  def quantile3(self):
424  """Gives the 3rd quantile of the sample."""
425  return self.location + self.scale
426 
427  def qmode(self):
428  """Gives the quantile of the mode of the sample."""
429  return 0.5
430 
431  def random(self, seed):
432  """Gives a random number based on the distribution."""
433  while 1:
434  seed = self.loaction + (self.scale * math.tan(PI * (seed - 0.5)))
435  yield seed

438 class CosineDistribution(Distribution):
439  """
440  Cosine distribution is sometimes used as a simple approximation to
441  Normal distribution.
442 
443  @see: Chen, KFQ, Ling, MHT. 2013. COPADS III (Compendium of
444  Distributions II): Cauchy, Cosine, Exponential, Hypergeometric,
445  Logarithmic, Semicircular, Triangular, and Weibull. The Python
446  Papers Source Codes 5: 2.
447 
448  @status: Tested method
449  @since: version 0.4
450  """
451 
452  def __init__(self, location=0.0, scale=1.0):
453  """
454  Constructor method. The parameters are used to construct the
455  probability distribution.
456 
457  @param location: the mean; default = 0.0
458  @param scale: spread of the distribution, S{lambda}; default = 1.0
459  """
460  self.location = location
461  self.scale = scale
462 
463  def CDF(self, x):
464  """
465  Cummulative Distribution Function, which gives the cummulative
466  probability (area under the probability curve) from -infinity or 0 to
467  a give x-value on the x-axis where y-axis is the probability."""
468  n = PI + (x - self.location) / self.scale + \
469  math.sin((x - self.location) / self.scale)
470  return n / PI2
471 
472  def PDF(self, x):
473  """
474  Partial Distribution Function, which gives the probability for the
475  particular value of x, or the area under probability distribution from
476  x-h to x+h for continuous distribution."""
477  return (1 / (PI2 * self.scale)) * \
478  (1 + math.cos((x - self.location) / self.scale))
479 
480  def inverseCDF(self, probability, start=0.0, step=0.01):
481  """
482  It does the reverse of CDF() method, it takes a probability value and
483  returns the corresponding value on the x-axis."""
484  cprob = self.CDF(start)
485  if probability < cprob: return (start, cprob)
486  while (probability > cprob):
487  start = start + step
488  cprob = self.CDF(start)
489  # print start, cprob
490  return (start, cprob)
491 
492  def mean(self):
493  """Gives the arithmetic mean of the sample."""
494  return self.location
495 
496  def mode(self):
497  """Gives the mode of the sample."""
498  return self.location
499 
500  def median(self):
501  """Gives the median of the sample."""
502  return self.location
503 
504  def kurtosis(self):
505  """Gives the kurtosis of the sample."""
506  return -0.5938
507 
508  def skew(self):
509  """Gives the skew of the sample."""
510  return 0.0
511 
512  def variance(self):
513  """Gives the variance of the sample."""
514  return (((PI * PI)/3) - 2) * (self.scale ** 2)
515 
516  def quantile1(self):
517  """Gives the 1st quantile of the sample."""
518  return self.location - (0.8317 * self.scale)
519 
520  def quantile3(self):
521  """Gives the 13rd quantile of the sample."""
522  return self.location + (0.8317 * self.scale)
523 
524  def qmean(self):
525  """Gives the quantile of the arithmetic mean of the sample."""
526  return 0.5
527 
528  def qmode(self):
529  """Gives the quantile of the mode of the sample."""
530  return 0.5

537 class ExponentialDistribution(Distribution):
538  """
539  Exponential distribution is the continuous version of Geometric
540  distribution. It is also a special case of Gamma distribution where
541  shape = 1
542 
543  @see: Chen, KFQ, Ling, MHT. 2013. COPADS III (Compendium of
544  Distributions II): Cauchy, Cosine, Exponential, Hypergeometric,
545  Logarithmic, Semicircular, Triangular, and Weibull. The Python
546  Papers Source Codes 5: 2.
547 
548  @status: Tested method
549  @since: version 0.4
550  """
551 
552  def __init__(self, location=0.0, scale=1.0):
553  """
554  Constructor method. The parameters are used to construct the
555  probability distribution.
556 
557  @param location: position of the distribution, default = 0.0
558  @param scale: spread of the distribution, S{lambda}; default = 1.0"""
559  self.location = location
560  self.scale = scale
561 
562  def CDF(self, x):
563  """
564  Cummulative Distribution Function, which gives the cummulative
565  probability (area under the probability curve) from -infinity or 0 to
566  a give x-value on the x-axis where y-axis is the probability."""
567  return 1 - math.exp((self.location - x) / self.scale)
568 
569  def PDF(self, x):
570  """
571  Partial Distribution Function, which gives the probability for the
572  particular value of x, or the area under probability distribution from
573  x-h to x+h for continuous distribution."""
574  return (1/self.scale) * math.exp((self.location - x)/self.scale)
575 
576  def inverseCDF(self, probability, start=0.0, step=0.01):
577  """
578  It does the reverse of CDF() method, it takes a probability value and
579  returns the corresponding value on the x-axis."""
580  cprob = self.CDF(start)
581  if probability < cprob: return (start, cprob)
582  while (probability > cprob):
583  start = start + step
584  cprob = self.CDF(start)
585  # print start, cprob
586  return (start, cprob)
587 
588  def mean(self):
589  """Gives the arithmetic mean of the sample."""
590  return self.location + self.scale
591 
592  def mode(self):
593  """Gives the mode of the sample."""
594  return self.location
595 
596  def median(self):
597  """Gives the median of the sample."""
598  return self.location + (self.scale * math.log10(2))
599 
600  def kurtosis(self):
601  """Gives the kurtosis of the sample."""
602  return 6.0
603 
604  def skew(self):
605  """Gives the skew of the sample."""
606  return 2.0
607 
608  def variance(self):
609  """Gives the variance of the sample."""
610  return self.scale * self.scale
611 
612  def quantile1(self):
613  """Gives the 1st quantile of the sample."""
614  return self.location + (self.scale * math.log10(1.333))
615 
616  def quantile3(self):
617  """Gives the 3rd quantile of the sample."""
618  return self.location + (self.scale * math.log10(4))
619 
620  def qmean(self):
621  """Gives the quantile of the arithmetic mean of the sample."""
622  return 0.6321
623 
624  def qmode(self):
625  """Gives the quantile of the mode of the sample."""
626  return 0.0
627 
628  def random(self):
629  """Gives a random number based on the distribution."""
630  return random.expovariate(1/self.location)

633 class FDistribution(Distribution):
634  """
635  Class for F Distribution.
636 
637  @see: Ling, MHT. 2009. Compendium of Distributions, I: Beta, Binomial, Chi-
638  Square, F, Gamma, Geometric, Poisson, Student's t, and Uniform. The Python
639  Papers Source Codes 1:4
640 
641  @status: Tested method
642  @since: version 0.2
643  """
644 
645  def __init__(self, df1=1, df2=1):
646  """
647  Constructor method. The parameters are used to construct the
648  probability distribution.
649 
650  @param df1: degrees of freedom for numerator
651  @param df2: degrees of freedom for denorminator
652  """
653  self.df1 = float(df1)
654  self.df2 = float(df2)
655 
656  def CDF(self, x):
657  """
658  Cummulative Distribution Function, which gives the cummulative
659  probability (area under the probability curve) from -infinity or 0 to
660  a give x-value on the x-axis where y-axis is the probability.
661  """
662  sub_x = (self.df1 * x) / (self.df1 * x + self.df2)
663  return nrpy.betai(self.df1 / 2.0, self.df2 / 2.0, sub_x)
664 
665  def PDF(self, x):
666  """
667  Partial Distribution Function, which gives the probability
668  for particular value of x, or the area under probability
669  distribution from x-h to x+h for continuous distribution.
670  """
671  x = float(x)
672  n1 = ((x * self.df1) ** self.df1) * (self.df2 ** self.df2)
673  n2 = (x * self.df1 + self.df2) ** (self.df1 + self.df2)
674  d = x * nrpy.beta(self.df1 / 2.0, self.df2 / 2.0)
675  return math.sqrt(n1 / n2) / d
676 
677  def inverseCDF(self, probability, start=0.0, step=0.01):
678  """
679  It does the reverse of CDF() method, it takes a probability value and
680  the corresponding value on the x-axis.
681  """
682  cprob = self.CDF(start)
683  if probability < cprob:
684  return (start, cprob)
685  while probability > cprob:
686  start = start + step
687  cprob = self.CDF(start)
688  return (start, cprob)
689 
690  def mean(self):
691  """Gives the arithmetic mean of the sample."""
692  return float(self.df2 / (self.df2 - 2))

695 class GammaDistribution(Distribution):
696  """
697  Class for Gamma Distribution.
698 
699  @see: Ling, MHT. 2009. Compendium of Distributions, I: Beta, Binomial, Chi-
700  Square, F, Gamma, Geometric, Poisson, Student's t, and Uniform. The Python
701  Papers Source Codes 1:4
702 
703  @status: Tested method
704  @since: version 0.2
705  """
706 
707  def __init__(self, location, scale, shape):
708  """
709  Constructor method. The parameters are used to construct the
710  probability distribution.
711 
712  @param location:
713  @param scale:
714  @param shape:"""
715  self.location = float(location)
716  self.scale = float(scale)
717  self.shape = float(shape)
718 
719  def CDF(self, x):
720  """
721  Cummulative Distribution Function, which gives the cummulative
722  probability (area under the probability curve) from -infinity or 0 to
723  a give x-value on the x-axis where y-axis is the probability.
724  """
725  return nrpy.gammp(self.shape, (x - self.location) / self.scale)
726 
727  def inverseCDF(self, probability, start=0.0, step=0.01):
728  """
729  It does the reverse of CDF() method, it takes a probability value and
730  the corresponding value on the x-axis.
731  """
732  cprob = self.CDF(start)
733  if probability < cprob:
734  return (start, cprob)
735  while probability > cprob:
736  start = start + step
737  cprob = self.CDF(start)
738  return (start, cprob)
739 
740  def mean(self):
741  """Gives the arithmetic mean of the sample."""
742  return self.location + (self.scale * self.shape)
743 
744  def mode(self):
745  """Gives the mode of the sample."""
746  return self.location + (self.scale * (self.shape - 1))
747 
748  def kurtosis(self):
749  """Gives the kurtosis of the sample."""
750  return 6 / self.shape
751 
752  def skew(self):
753  """Gives the skew of the sample."""
754  return 2 / math.sqrt(self.shape)
755 
756  def variance(self):
757  """Gives the variance of the sample."""
758  return self.scale * self.scale * self.shape
759 
760  def qmean(self):
761  """Gives the quantile of the arithmetic mean of the sample."""
762  return nrpy.gammp(self.shape, self.shape)
763 
764  def qmode(self):
765  """Gives the quantile of the mode of the sample."""
766  return nrpy.gammp(self.shape, self.shape - 1)

820 class GeometricDistribution(Distribution):
821  """
822  Geometric distribution is the discrete version of Exponential
823  distribution.
824 
825  @see: Ling, MHT. 2009. Compendium of Distributions, I: Beta, Binomial, Chi-
826  Square, F, Gamma, Geometric, Poisson, Student's t, and Uniform. The Python
827  Papers Source Codes 1:4
828 
829  @status: Tested method
830  @since: version 0.2
831  """
832 
833  def __init__(self, success=0.5):
834  """
835  Constructor method. The parameters are used to construct the
836  probability distribution.
837 
838  @param success: probability of success; 0 <= success <= 1;
839  default = 0.5
840  """
841  self.prob = float(success)
842 
843  def CDF(self, x):
844  """
845  Cummulative Distribution Function, which gives the cummulative
846  probability (area under the probability curve) from -infinity or 0 to
847  a give x-value on the x-axis where y-axis is the probability.
848  """
849  total = self.PDF(1)
850  for i in range(2, int(x) + 1):
851  total += self.PDF(i)
852  return total
853 
854  def PDF(self, x):
855  """
856  Partial Distribution Function, which gives the probability
857  for particular value of x, or the area under probability
858  distribution from x-h to x+h for continuous distribution.
859  """
860  return self.prob * ((1 - self.prob) ** (x - 1))
861 
862  def inverseCDF(self, probability, start=1, step=1):
863  """
864  It does the reverse of CDF() method, it takes a probability value and
865  the corresponding value on the x-axis.
866  """
867  cprob = self.CDF(start)
868  if probability < cprob:
869  return (start, cprob)
870  while probability > cprob:
871  start = start + step
872  cprob = self.CDF(start)
873  return (start, cprob)
874 
875  def mean(self):
876  """Gives the arithmetic mean of the sample."""
877  return 1/self.prob
878 
879  def mode(self):
880  """Gives the mode of the sample."""
881  return 1.0
882 
883  def variance(self):
884  """Gives the variance of the sample."""
885  return (1 - self.prob) / (self.prob ** 2)

888 class HypergeometricDistribution(Distribution):
889  """
890  Class for Hypergeometric distribution
891 
892  @see: Chen, KFQ, Ling, MHT. 2013. COPADS III (Compendium of
893  Distributions II): Cauchy, Cosine, Exponential, Hypergeometric,
894  Logarithmic, Semicircular, Triangular, and Weibull. The Python
895  Papers Source Codes 5: 2.
896 
897  @status: Tested method
898  @since: version 0.4
899  """
900 
901  def __init__(self, sample_size,
902  population_size=100,
903  population_success=50):
904  """
905  Constructor method. The parameters are used to construct the
906  probability distribution.
907 
908  @param sample_size: sample size (not more than population size)
909  @type sample_size: integer
910  @param population_size: population size; default = 100
911  @type population_size: integer
912  @param population_success: number of successes in the population
913  (cannot be more than population size); default = 10
914  @type population_success: integer"""
915  if population_success > population_size:
916  raise AttributeError('population_success cannot be more \
917  than population_size')
918  elif sample_size > population_size:
919  raise AttributeError('sample_size cannot be more \
920  than population_size')
921  else:
922  self.psize = int(population_size)
923  self.psuccess = int(population_success)
924  self.ssize = int(sample_size)
925 
926  def CDF(self, sample_success):
927  """
928  Cummulative Distribution Function, which gives the cummulative
929  probability (area under the probability curve) from -infinity or 0 to
930  a give x-value (sample_success, an integer that is not more than sample
931  size) on the x-axis where y-axis is the probability."""
932  if sample_success > self.ssize:
933  raise AttributeError('sample_success cannot be more \
934  than sample_size')
935  else:
936  return sum([self.PDF(n) for n in range(1, sample_success+1)])
937 
938  def PDF(self, sample_success):
939  """
940  Partial Distribution Function, which gives the probability for the
941  particular value of x (sample_success, an integer that is not more
942  than sample size), or the area under probability distribution from
943  x-h to x+h for continuous distribution."""
944  if sample_success > self.ssize:
945  raise AttributeError('sample_success cannot be more \
946  than sample_size')
947  else:
948  sample_success = int(sample_success)
949  numerator = nrpy.bico(self.psuccess, sample_success)
950  numerator = numerator * nrpy.bico(self.psize-self.psuccess,
951  self.ssize-sample_success)
952  denominator = nrpy.bico(self.psize, self.ssize)
953  return float(numerator)/float(denominator)
954 
955  def inverseCDF(self, probability, start=1, step=1):
956  """
957  It does the reverse of CDF() method, it takes a probability value
958  and returns the corresponding value on the x-axis."""
959  cprob = self.CDF(start)
960  if probability < cprob: return (start, cprob)
961  while (probability > cprob):
962  start = start + step
963  cprob = self.CDF(start)
964  # print start, cprob
965  return (int(start), cprob)
966 
967  def mean(self):
968  """Gives the arithmetic mean of the sample."""
969  return self.ssize * (float(self.psuccess)/float(self.psize))
970 
971  def mode(self):
972  """Gives the mode of the sample."""
973  temp = (self.ssize + 1) * (self.psuccess + 1)
974  return float(temp)/float(self.psize + 2)
975 
976 # def kurtosis(self):
977 # """Gives the kurtosis of the sample."""
978 # raise DistributionFunctionError
979 # def skew(self):
980 # """Gives the skew of the sample."""
981 # raise DistributionFunctionError
982 
983  def variance(self):
984  """Gives the variance of the sample."""
985  t1 = float(self.psize-self.psuccess)/float(self.psize)
986  t2 = float(self.psize-self.ssize)/float(self.psize-1)
987  return self.mean() * t1 * t2

1008 class LogarithmicDistribution(Distribution):
1009  """
1010  Class for Logarithmic Distribution.
1011 
1012  @see: Chen, KFQ, Ling, MHT. 2013. COPADS III (Compendium of
1013  Distributions II): Cauchy, Cosine, Exponential, Hypergeometric,
1014  Logarithmic, Semicircular, Triangular, and Weibull. The Python
1015  Papers Source Codes 5: 2.
1016 
1017  @status: Tested method
1018  @since: version 0.4
1019  """
1020 
1021  def __init__(self, shape):
1022  """Constructor method. The parameters are used to construct the
1023  probability distribution.
1024 
1025  @param shape: the spread of the distribution"""
1026  self.shape = shape
1027 
1028  def CDF(self, x):
1029  """
1030  Cummulative Distribution Function, which gives the cummulative
1031  probability (area under the probability curve) from -infinity or 0 to
1032  a give x-value on the x-axis where y-axis is the probability."""
1033  summation = 0.0
1034  for i in range(int(x)): summation = summation + self.PDF(i)
1035  return summation
1036 
1037  def PDF(self, x):
1038  """
1039  Partial Distribution Function, which gives the probability for the
1040  particular value of x, or the area under probability distribution from
1041  x-h to x+h for continuous distribution."""
1042  return (-1 * (self.shape ** x)) / (math.log10(1 - self.shape) * x)
1043 
1044  def inverseCDF(self, probability, start=0.0, step=0.01):
1045  """
1046  It does the reverse of CDF() method, it takes a probability value and
1047  returns the corresponding value on the x-axis."""
1048  cprob = self.CDF(start)
1049  if probability < cprob: return (start, cprob)
1050  while (probability > cprob):
1051  start = start + step
1052  cprob = self.CDF(start)
1053  # print start, cprob
1054  return (start, cprob)
1055 
1056  def mean(self):
1057  """Gives the arithmetic mean of the sample."""
1058  return (-1 * self.shape) / ((1 - self.shape) * \
1059  math.log10(1 - self.shape))
1060 
1061  def mode(self):
1062  """Gives the mode of the sample."""
1063  return 1.0
1064 
1065  def variance(self):
1066  """Gives the variance of the sample."""
1067  n = (-1 * self.shape) * (self.shape + math.log10(1 - self.shape))
1068  d = ((1 - self.shape) ** 2) * math.log10(1 - self.shape) * \
1069  math.log10(1 - self.shape)
1070  return n / d

1072 # """Gives a random number based on the distribution."""
1073 # raise DistributionFunctionError

1076 class NormalDistribution(Distribution):
1077  """
1078  Class for standardized normal distribution (area under the curve = 1)
1079 
1080  @see: Ling, MHT. 2009. Ten Z-Test Routines from Gopal Kanji's 100
1081  Statistical Tests. The Python Papers Source Codes 1:5
1082 
1083  @status: Tested method
1084  @since: version 0.1
1085  """
1086  def __init__(self):
1087  self.mean = 0.0
1088  self.stdev = 1.0
1089 
1090  def CDF(self, x):
1091  """
1092  Cummulative Distribution Function, which gives the cummulative
1093  probability (area under the probability curve) from -infinity or 0 to
1094  a give x-value on the x-axis where y-axis is the probability.
1095  """
1096  return 1.0 - 0.5 * nrpy.erfcc(x/SQRT2)
1097 
1098  def PDF(self, x):
1099  """
1100  Calculates the density (probability) at x by the formula
1101  f(x) = 1/(sqrt(2 pi) sigma) e^-((x^2/(2 sigma^2))
1102  where mu is the mean of the distribution and sigma the standard
1103  deviation.
1104 
1105  @param x: probability at x
1106  """
1107  return (1/(math.sqrt(PI2) * self.stdev)) * \
1108  math.exp(-(x ** 2/(2 * self.stdev**2)))
1109 
1110  def inverseCDF(self, probability, start = -10.0,
1111  end = 10.0, error = 10e-8):
1112  """
1113  It does the reverse of CDF() method, it takes a probability value and
1114  returns the corresponding value on the x-axis, together with the
1115  cumulative probability.
1116 
1117  @param probability: probability under the curve from -infinity
1118  @param start: lower boundary of calculation (default = -10)
1119  @param end: upper boundary of calculation (default = 10)
1120  @param error: error between the given and calculated probabilities
1121  (default = 10e-8)
1122  @return: Returns a tuple (start, cprob) where 'start' is the standard
1123  deviation for the area under the curve from -infinity to the given
1124  'probability' (+/- step). 'cprob' is the calculated area under the
1125  curve from -infinity to the returned 'start'.
1126  """
1127  # check for tolerance
1128  if abs(self.CDF(start)-probability) < error:
1129  return (start, self.CDF(start))
1130  # case 1: lower than -10 standard deviations
1131  if probability < self.CDF(start):
1132  return self.inverseCDF(probability, start-5, start, error)
1133  # case 2: between -10 to 10 standard deviations (bisection method)
1134  if probability > self.CDF(start) and \
1135  probability < self.CDF((start+end)/2):
1136  return self.inverseCDF(probability, start, (start+end)/2, error)
1137  if probability > self.CDF((start+end)/2) and \
1138  probability < self.CDF(end):
1139  return self.inverseCDF(probability, (start+end)/2, end, error)
1140  # case 3: higher than 10 standard deviations
1141  if probability > self.CDF(end):
1142  return self.inverseCDF(probability, end, end+5, error)
1143 
1144  def mean(self):
1145  return self.mean
1146 
1147  def mode(self):
1148  return self.mean
1149 
1150  def kurtosis(self):
1151  return 0.0
1152 
1153  def skew(self):
1154  return 0.0
1155 
1156  def variance(self):
1157  return self.stdev * self.stdev
1158 
1159  def random(self):
1160  """Gives a random number based on the distribution."""
1161  return random.gauss(self.mean, self.stdev)

1164 class PoissonDistribution(Distribution):

1166  Class for Poisson Distribution. Poisson distribution is binomial
1167  distribution with very low success - that is, for rare events.

1177  def __init__(self, expectation=0.001):

1183  """

1198  distribution from x-h to x+h for continuous distribution.
1199  """
1200  return (math.exp(-1 ** self._mean) *
1201  (self._mean ** x)) / nrpy.factrl(x)

1211  while probability > cprob:

1213  cprob = self.CDF(start)
1214  return (start, cprob)

1229 class SemicircularDistribution(Distribution):

1231  Class for Semicircular Distribution.

1234  Distributions II): Cauchy, Cosine, Exponential, Hypergeometric,
1235  Logarithmic, Semicircular, Triangular, and Weibull. The Python
1236  Papers Source Codes 5: 2.
1237

1242  def __init__(self, location=0.0, scale=1.0):
1243  """
1244  Constructor method. The parameters are used to construct the
1245  probability distribution.
1246 
1247  @param location: mean of the distribution, default = 0.0
1248  @param scale: spread of the distribution, default = 1.0"""
1249  self.location = location
1250  self.scale = scale
1251 
1252  def CDF(self, x):
1253  """
1254  Cummulative Distribution Function, which gives the cummulative
1255  probability (area under the probability curve) from -infinity or 0 to
1256  a give x-value on the x-axis where y-axis is the probability."""
1257  t = (x - self.location) / self.scale
1258  return 0.5 + (1 / PI) * (t * math.sqrt(1 - (t ** 2)) + math.asin(t))

1260  def PDF(self, x):
1261  """
1262  Partial Distribution Function, which gives the probability for the
1263  particular value of x, or the area under probability distribution from
1264  x-h to x+h for continuous distribution."""
1265  return (2 / (self.scale * PI)) * \
1266  math.sqrt(1 - ((x - self.location) / self.scale) ** 2)
1267 
1268  def inverseCDF(self, probability, start=-10.0, step=0.01):
1269  """
1270  It does the reverse of CDF() method, it takes a probability value and
1271  returns the corresponding value on the x-axis."""
1272  if start < -1 * self.scale:
1273  start = -1 * self.scale
1274  cprob = self.CDF(start)
1275  if probability < cprob: return (start, cprob)
1276  while (probability > cprob):
1277  start = start + step
1278  cprob = self.CDF(start)
1279  # print start, cprob
1280  return (start, cprob)

1284  return self.location

1287  """Gives the mode of the sample."""
1288  return self.location
1289

1291  """Gives the kurtosis of the sample."""
1292  return -1.0
1293 
1294  def skew(self):
1295  """Gives the skew of the sample."""
1296  return 0.0

1299  """Gives the variance of the sample."""
1300  return 0.25 * (self.scale ** 2)

1303  """Gives the 1st quantile of the sample."""
1304  return self.location - (0.404 * self.scale)

1322 class TDistribution(Distribution):
1323  """
1324  Class for Student's t-distribution.
1325 
1326  @see: Ling, MHT. 2009. Compendium of Distributions, I: Beta, Binomial, Chi-
1327  Square, F, Gamma, Geometric, Poisson, Student's t, and Uniform. The Python
1328  Papers Source Codes 1:4
1329 
1330  @status: Tested method
1331  @since: version 0.2
1332  """
1333 
1334  def __init__(self, location=0.0, scale=1.0, shape=2):
1335  """Constructor method. The parameters are used to construct
1336  the probability distribution.
1337 
1338  @param location: default = 0.0
1339  @param scale: default = 1.0
1340  @param shape: degrees of freedom; default = 2"""
1341  self._mean = float(location)
1342  self.stdev = float(scale)
1343  self.df = float(shape)
1344 
1345  def CDF(self, x):
1346  """
1347  Cummulative Distribution Function, which gives the cummulative
1348  probability (area under the probability curve) from -infinity or 0 to
1349  a give x-value on the x-axis where y-axis is the probability.
1350  """
1351  t = (x - self._mean) / self.stdev
1352  a = nrpy.betai(self.df / 2.0, 0.5, self.df / (self.df + (t * t)))
1353  if t > 0:
1354  return 1 - 0.5 * a
1355  else:
1356  return 0.5 * a
1357 
1358  def PDF(self, x):
1359  """
1360  Calculates the density (probability) at x with n-th degrees of freedom
1361  as
1362  M{f(x) = S{Gamma}((n+1)/2) /
1363  (sqrt(n * pi) S{Gamma}(n/2)) (1 + x^2/n)^-((n+1)/2)}
1364 
1365  for all real x. It has mean 0 (for n > 1) and variance n/(n-2)
1366  (for n > 2)."""
1367  a = nrpy.gammln((self.df + 1) / 2)
1368  b = math.sqrt(math.pi * self.df) * nrpy.gammln(self.df / 2) * \
1369  self.stdev
1370  c = 1 + ((((x - self._mean) / self.stdev) ** 2) / self.df)
1371  return (a / b) * (c ** ((-1 - self.df) / 2))
1372 
1373  def inverseCDF(self, probability, start = -10.0,
1374  end = 10.0, error = 10e-8):
1375  """
1376  It does the reverse of CDF() method, it takes a probability value and
1377  returns the corresponding value on the x-axis, together with the
1378  cumulative probability.
1379 
1380  @param probability: probability under the curve from -infinity
1381  @param start: lower boundary of calculation (default = -10)
1382  @param end: upper boundary of calculation (default = 10)
1383  @param error: error between the given and calculated probabilities
1384  (default = 10e-8)
1385  @return: Returns a tuple (start, cprob) where 'start' is the standard
1386  deviation for the area under the curve from -infinity to the given
1387  'probability' (+/- step). 'cprob' is the calculated area under the
1388  curve from -infinity to the returned 'start'.
1389  """
1390  # check for tolerance
1391  if abs(self.CDF(start)-probability) < error:
1392  return (start, self.CDF(start))
1393  # case 1: lower than -10 standard deviations
1394  if probability < self.CDF(start):
1395  return self.inverseCDF(probability, start-10, start, error)
1396  # case 2: between -10 to 10 standard deviations (bisection method)
1397  if probability > self.CDF(start) and \
1398  probability < self.CDF((start+end)/2):
1399  return self.inverseCDF(probability, start, (start+end)/2, error)
1400  if probability > self.CDF((start+end)/2) and \
1401  probability < self.CDF(end):
1402  return self.inverseCDF(probability, (start+end)/2, end, error)
1403  # case 3: higher than 10 standard deviations
1404  if probability > self.CDF(end):
1405  return self.inverseCDF(probability, end, end+10, error)
1406  # cprob = self.CDF(start)
1407  # if probability < cprob:
1408  # return (start, cprob)
1409  # while probability > cprob:
1410  # start = start + step
1411  # cprob = self.CDF(start)
1412  # return (start, cprob)
1413 
1414  def mean(self):
1415  """Gives the arithmetic mean of the sample."""
1416  return self._mean
1417 
1418  def mode(self):
1419  """Gives the mode of the sample."""
1420  return self._mean
1421 
1422  def kurtosis(self):
1423  """Gives the kurtosis of the sample."""
1424  a = ((self.df - 2) ** 2) * nrpy.gammln((self.df / 2) - 2)
1425  return 3 * ((a / (4 * nrpy.gammln(self.df / 2))) - 1)
1426 
1427  def skew(self):
1428  """Gives the skew of the sample."""
1429  return 0.0
1430 
1431  def variance(self):
1432  """Gives the variance of the sample."""
1433  return (self.df / (self.df - 2)) * self.stdev * self.stdev

1436 class TriangularDistribution(Distribution):
1437  """
1438  Class for Triangular Distribution.
1439 
1440  @see: Chen, KFQ, Ling, MHT. 2013. COPADS III (Compendium of
1441  Distributions II): Cauchy, Cosine, Exponential, Hypergeometric,
1442  Logarithmic, Semicircular, Triangular, and Weibull. The Python
1443  Papers Source Codes 5: 2.
1444 
1445  @status: Tested method
1446  @since: version 0.4
1447  """
1448  def __init__(self, upper_limit, peak, lower_limit=0):
1449  """
1450  Constructor method. The parameters are used to construct the
1451  probability distribution.
1452 
1453  @param upper_limit: upper limit of the distrbution
1454  @type upper_limit: float
1455  @param peak: peak of the distrbution, which has to be between
1456  the lower and upper limits of the distribution
1457  @type peak: float
1458  @param lower_limit: lower limit of the distrbution,
1459  default = 0
1460  @type lower_limit: float"""
1461  self.lower_limit = lower_limit
1462  if upper_limit < self.lower_limit:
1463  raise AttributeError
1464  else:
1465  self.upper_limit = upper_limit
1466  if peak > upper_limit:
1467  raise AttributeError
1468  if peak < lower_limit + 0.001:
1469  raise AttributeError
1470  else:
1471  self.mode = peak
1472 
1473  def CDF(self, x):
1474  """
1475  Cummulative Distribution Function, which gives the cummulative
1476  probability (area under the probability curve) from -infinity or 0 to
1477  a give x-value on the x-axis where y-axis is the probability."""
1478  if x < self.lower_limit:
1479  raise AttributeError
1480  if x > self.mode:
1481  raise AttributeError
1482  else:
1483  return (( x - self.lower_limit) ** 2) / \
1484  ((self.upper_limit - self.lower_limit) * \
1485  (self.mode - self.lower_limit))
1486 
1487  def PDF(self, x):
1488  """
1489  Partial Distribution Function, which gives the probability for the
1490  particular value of x, or the area under probability distribution
1491  from x-h to x+h for continuous distribution."""
1492  if x < self.lower_limit:
1493  raise AttributeError
1494  if x > self.mode:
1495  raise AttributeError
1496  else:
1497  return ((2 * (x - self.lower_limit)) / \
1498  ((self.upper_limit - self.lower_limit) * \
1499  (self.mode - self.lower_limit)))
1500 
1501  def inverseCDF(self, probability, start=0, step=0.01):
1502  """
1503  It does the reverse of CDF() method, it takes a probability value
1504  and returns the corresponding value on the x-axis."""
1505  start = self.lower_limit
1506  cprob = self.CDF(start)
1507  if probability < cprob: return (start, cprob)
1508  while (probability > cprob):
1509  start = start + step
1510  cprob = self.CDF(start)
1511  # print start, cprob
1512  return (start, cprob)
1513 
1514  def mean(self):
1515  """Gives the arithmetic mean of the sample."""
1516  return (float(self.lower_limit + self.upper_limit + self.mode) / 3)
1517 
1518  def mode(self):
1519  """Gives the mode of the sample."""
1520  return (self.mode)
1521 
1522  def kurtosis(self):
1523  """Gives the kurtosis of the sample."""
1524  return ((-3)*(5 ** - 1))
1525 
1526  def skew(self):
1527  """Gives the skew of the sample."""
1528  return (math.sqrt(2) * (self.lower_limit + self.upper_limit - 2 * \
1529  self.mode) * (2 * self.lower_limit - self.self.upper_limit - self.mode) \
1530  * (self.lower_limit - 2 * self.upper_limit + self.mode)) \
1531  / (self.lower_limit ** 2 + self.upper_limit ** 2 + self.mode ** 2 - \
1532  self.lower_limit * self.upper_limit + self.mode ** 2 - self.lower_limit * \
1533  (self.upper_limit - self.mode))
1534 
1535  def variance(self):
1536  """Gives the variance of the sample."""
1537  return (self.lower_limit ** 2 + self.upper_limit ** 2 + self.mode ** 2\
1538  - (self.lower_limit * self.upper_limit) - \
1539  (self.lower_limit * self.mode) - (self.upper_limit * self.mode))\
1540  *(18 ** -1)
1541 
1542  def quantile1(self):
1543  """Gives the 1st quantile of the sample."""
1544  if ((self.mode - self.lower_limit) * \
1545  (self.upper_limit - self.lower_limit) ** -1) > 0.25:
1546  return self.lower_limit + (0.5 * math.sqrt((self.upper_limit - \
1547  self.lower_limit) * (self.mode - self.lower_limit)))
1548  else:
1549  return self.upper_limit - ((0.5) * math.sqrt (3 * (self.upper_limit -\
1550  self.lower_limit) * (self.upper_limit - self.mode)))
1551 
1552  def quantile3(self):
1553  """Gives the 3rd quantile of the sample."""
1554  if ((self.mode - self.lower_limit) * \
1555  (self.upper_limit - self.lower_limit) ** -1) > 0.75:
1556  return self.lower_limit + (0.5 * math.sqrt(3 * (self.upper_limit - \
1557  self.lower_limit) * (self.mode - self.lower_limit)))
1558  else:
1559  return self.upper_limit - ((0.5) * math.sqrt ((self.upper_limit -\
1560  self.lower_limit) * (self.upper_limit - self.mode)))
1561 
1562  def qmean(self):
1563  """Gives the quantile of the arithmetic mean of the sample."""
1564  if self.mode > ((self.lower_limit + self.upper_limit) * 0.5):
1565  return ((self.upper_limit + self.mode - 2 * self.lower_limit) ** 2)\
1566  * (9 * (self.upper_limit - self.lower_limit) * (self.mode - \
1567  self.lower_limit))
1568  else:
1569  return (self.lower_limit ** 2 + (5 * self.lower_limit * \
1570  self.upper_limit) - (5 * (self.upper_limit ** 2)) - \
1571  (7 * self.lower_limit * self.mode) + (5 * self. upper_limit * \
1572  self.mode) + self.mode ** 2)
1573 
1574  def qmode(self):
1575  """Gives the quantile of the mode of the sample."""
1576  return (self.mode - self.lower_limit) * (self.upper_limit \
1577  - self.lower_limit) ** - 1

1632  start = start + step
1633  cprob = self.CDF(start)
1634  return (start, cprob)

1673 class WeiBullDistribution(Distribution):
1674  """
1675  Class for Weibull distribution.
1676 
1677  @see: Chen, KFQ, Ling, MHT. 2013. COPADS III (Compendium of
1678  Distributions II): Cauchy, Cosine, Exponential, Hypergeometric,
1679  Logarithmic, Semicircular, Triangular, and Weibull. The Python
1680  Papers Source Codes 5: 2.
1681 
1682  @status: Tested method
1683  @since: version 0.4
1684  """
1685  def __init__(self, location=1.0, scale=1.0):
1686  """Constructor method. The parameters are used to construct the
1687  probability distribution.
1688 
1689  @param location: position of the distribution, default = 1.0
1690  @param scale: shape of the distribution, default = 1.0"""
1691  self.location = location
1692  self.scale = scale
1693 
1694  def CDF(self, x):
1695  """
1696  Cummulative Distribution Function, which gives the cummulative
1697  probability (area under the probability curve) from -infinity or 0
1698  to a give x-value on the x-axis where y-axis is the probability."""
1699  power = -1 * ((float(x) / self.location) ** self.scale)
1700  return 1 - (math.e ** power)
1701 
1702  def PDF(self, x):
1703  """
1704  Partial Distribution Function, which gives the probability for the
1705  particular value of x, or the area under trobability distribution
1706  from x-h to x+h for continuous distribution."""
1707  if x < 0:
1708  return 0
1709  else:
1710  power = -1 * ((float(x) / self.location) ** self.scale)
1711  t3 = math.e ** power
1712  t2 = (float(x) / self.location) ** (self.scale - 1)
1713  t1 = self.scale / self.location
1714  return t1 * t2 * t3
1715 
1716  def inverseCDF(self, probability, start=0.0, step=0.01):
1717  """
1718  It does the reverse of CDF() method, it takes a probability value and
1719  returns the corresponding value on the x-axis."""
1720  cprob = self.CDF(start)
1721  if probability < cprob: return (start, cprob)
1722  while (probability > cprob):
1723  start = start + step
1724  cprob = self.CDF(start)
1725  # print start, cprob
1726  return (start, cprob)
1727 
1728  # def mean(self):
1729  # """Gives the arithmetic mean of the sample."""
1730  # return self.location * nrpy.gammln(1 + 1/self.scale)
1731 
1732  def median(self):
1733  """Gives the median of the sample."""
1734  return self.location * (math.log(2, math.e) ** (1/float(self.scale)))
1735 
1736  def mode(self):
1737  """Gives the mode of the sample."""
1738  if self.scale > 1:
1739  t = ((self.scale - 1) / float(self.scale))
1740  return self.location * (t ** (1/float(self.scale)))
1741  else:
1742  return 0

1835 class BradfordDistribution(Distribution):
1836  """Class for Bradford distribution."""
1837 
1838  def __init__(self, location, scale, shape):
1839  """
1840  Constructor method. The parameters are used to construct the
1841  probability distribution.
1842 
1843  @param location:
1844  @param scale: upper bound
1845  @param shape:"""
1846  self.location = location
1847  self.scale = scale
1848  self.shape = shape
1849  self.k = math.log10(self.shape + 1)
1850 
1851  def CDF(self, x):
1852  """
1853  Cummulative Distribution Function, which gives the cummulative
1854  probability (area under the probability curve) from -infinity or 0 to
1855  a give x-value on the x-axis where y-axis is the probability."""
1856  r = ((self.shape * (x - self.location)) / (self.scale - self.location))
1857  return math.log10(1 + r) / self.k
1858 
1859  def PDF(self, x):
1860  """
1861  Partial Distribution Function, which gives the probability for the
1862  particular value of x, or the area under probability distribution
1863  from x-h to x+h for continuous distribution."""
1864  r = (self.shape * (x - self.location)) + self.scale - self.location
1865  return self.shape / (self.k * r)
1866 
1867  def inverseCDF(self, probability, start=0.0, step=0.01):
1868  """
1869  It does the reverse of CDF() method, it takes a probability value
1870  and returns the corresponding value on the x-axis."""
1871  cprob = self.CDF(start)
1872  if probability < cprob: return (start, cprob)
1873  while (probability > cprob):
1874  start = start + step
1875  cprob = self.CDF(start)
1876  # print start, cprob
1877  return (start, cprob)
1878 
1879  def mean(self):
1880  """Gives the arithmetic mean of the sample."""
1881  r = self.shape * (self.scale - self.location)
1882  r = r + (((self.shape + 1) * self.location - self.scale) * self.k)
1883  return r / (self.shape * self.k)
1884 
1885  def mode(self):
1886  """Gives the mode of the sample."""
1887  return self.location
1888 
1889  def kurtosis(self):
1890  """Gives the kurtosis of the sample."""
1891  d = ((self.shape * (self.k - 2)) + (2 * self.k)) ** 2
1892  d = 3 * self.shape * d
1893  n = ((self.k * ((3 * self.k) - 16)) + 24)
1894  n = (self.shape ** 3) * (self.k - 3) * n
1895  n = n + ((self.k - 4) * (self.k - 3) * (12 * self.k * (self.k **2)))
1896  n = n + (6 * self.k * (self.k **2)) * ((3 * self.k) - 14)
1897  return (n + (12 * (self.k ** 3))) / d
1898 
1899  def skew(self):
1900  """Gives the skew of the sample."""
1901  r = 12 * (self.shape ** 2)
1902  r = r - (9 * self.k * self.shape * (self.shape + 2))
1903  r = r + ((2 * self.k * self.k) * ((self.shape * (self.shape + 3)) + 3))
1904  d = self.shape * (((self.k - 2) * self.shape) + (2 * self.k))
1905  d = math.sqrt(d)
1906  d = d * ((3 * self.shape * (self.k - 2)) + (6 * self.k))
1907  return r / d
1908 
1909  def variance(self):
1910  """Gives the variance of the sample."""
1911  r = (self.scale - self.location) ** 2
1912  r = r * (self.shape * (self.k - 2) + (2 * self.k))
1913  return r / (2 * self.shape * self.k * self.k)
1914 
1915  def quantile1(self):
1916  """Gives the 1st quantile of the sample."""
1917  r = (self.location * (self.shape + 1)) - self.scale
1918  r = r + ((self.scale - self.location) * ((self.shape + 1)** 0.25))
1919  return r / self.shape
1920 
1921  def quantile3(self):
1922  """Gives the 3rd quantile of the sample."""
1923  r = (self.location * (self.shape + 1)) - self.scale
1924  r = r + ((self.scale - self.location) * ((self.shape + 1)** 0.75))
1925  return r / self.shape
1926 
1927  def qmean(self):
1928  """Gives the quantile of the arithmetic mean of the sample."""
1929  r = math.log10(self.shape / math.log10(self.shape + 1))
1930  return r / math.log10(self.shape + 1)
1931 
1932  def qmode(self):
1933  """Gives the quantile of the mode of the sample."""
1934  return 0.0
1935 
1936  def random(self, seed):
1937  """Gives a random number based on the distribution."""
1938  while 1:
1939  r = self.location * (self.shape + 1) - self.scale
1940  r = r + ((self.scale - self.location)*((self.shape + 1) ** seed))
1941  seed = r / self.shape
1942  yield seed

1945 class BurrDistribution(Distribution):
1946  """
1947  Burr distribution is the generalization of Fisk distribution. Burr
1948  distribution with D = 1 becomes Fisk distribution.
1949  """
1950  def __init__(self, location, scale, C, D):
1951  """
1952  Constructor method. The parameters are used to construct the
1953  probability distribution.
1954 
1955  @param location:
1956  @param scale:
1957  @param C: shape
1958  @param D: shape"""
1959  self.location = location
1960  self.scale = scale
1961  self.C = C
1962  self.D = D
1963  self.k = (nrpy.gammln(self.D) * \
1964  nrpy.gammln(1 - (2/self.C)) * \
1965  nrpy.gammln((2/self.C) + self.D)) - \
1966  ((nrpy.gammln(1 - (1/self.C)) ** 2) * \
1967  (nrpy.gammln((1/self.C) + self.D) ** 2))
1968  def CDF(self, x):
1969  """
1970  Cummulative Distribution Function, which gives the cummulative
1971  probability (area under the probability curve) from -infinity or 0 to
1972  a give x-value on the x-axis where y-axis is the probability."""
1973  return (1+(((x - self.location)/self.scale)**(-self.C)))**(-self.D)
1974  def PDF(self, x):
1975  """
1976  Partial Distribution Function, which gives the probability for the
1977  particular value of x, or the area under probability distribution
1978  from x-h to x+h for continuous distribution."""
1979  r = (1+(((x - self.location)/self.scale)**(-self.C)))**(-self.D - 1)
1980  r = r * ((self.C * self.D)/self.scale)
1981  return r * (((x - self.location)/self.scale)**(-self.C - 1))
1982  def inverseCDF(self, probability, start=0.0, step=0.01):
1983  """
1984  It does the reverse of CDF() method, it takes a probability value
1985  and returns the corresponding value on the x-axis."""
1986  cprob = self.CDF(start)
1987  if probability < cprob: return (start, cprob)
1988  while (probability > cprob):
1989  start = start + step
1990  cprob = self.CDF(start)
1991  # print start, cprob
1992  return (start, cprob)
1993  def mean(self):
1994  """Gives the arithmetic mean of the sample."""
1995  r = nrpy.gammln(1 - (1/self.C)) * nrpy.gammln((1/self.C) + self.D)
1996  return self.location + ((r * self.scale) / nrpy.gammln(self.D))
1997  def mode(self):
1998  """Gives the mode of the sample."""
1999  if ((self.C * self.D) < 1): return self.location
2000  else:
2001  r = (((self.C * self.D)-1)/(self.C + 1)) ** (1/self.C)
2002  return self.location + (self.scale * r)
2003 # def kurtosis(self):
2004 # """Gives the kurtosis of the sample."""
2005 # raise DistributionFunctionError
2006 # def skew(self):
2007 # """Gives the skew of the sample."""
2008 # raise DistributionFunctionError
2009  def variance(self):
2010  """Gives the variance of the sample."""
2011  return (self.k * (self.scale ** 2)) / (nrpy.gammln(self.D) ** 2)
2012 # def quantile1(self):
2013 # """Gives the 1st quantile of the sample."""
2014 # raise DistributionFunctionError
2015 # def quantile3(self):
2016 # """Gives the 3rd quantile of the sample."""
2017 # raise DistributionFunctionError
2018 # def qmean(self):
2019 # """Gives the quantile of the arithmetic mean of the sample."""
2020 # raise DistributionFunctionError
2021  def qmode(self):
2022  """Gives the quantile of the mode of the sample."""
2023  if ((self.C * self.D) < 1): return 0.0
2024  else:
2025  return (1 + ((self.C+1)/((self.C*self.D) - 1))) ** (-1*self.D)
2026  def random(self, seed):
2027  """Gives a random number based on the distribution."""
2028  while 1:
2029  r = ((1/(seed ** (1/self.D))) - 1) ** (-1/self.C)
2030  seed = self.location + self.scale * r
2031  yield seed

2111 class DoubleGammaDistribution(Distribution):
2112  """
2113  Double Gamma distribution is the signed version of Gamma distribution.
2114  """
2115  def __init__(self, location, scale, shape):
2116  """
2117  Constructor method. The parameters are used to construct the
2118  probability distribution.
2119 
2120  @param location:
2121  @param scale:
2122  @param shape:"""
2123  self.location = location
2124  self.scale = scale
2125  self.shape = shape
2126 
2127  def CDF(self, x):
2128  """
2129  Cummulative Distribution Function, which gives the cummulative
2130  probability (area under the probability curve) from -infinity or 0 to
2131  a give x-value on the x-axis where y-axis is the probability."""
2132  r = nrpy.gammp(self.shape ,abs((x - self.location)/self.scale))
2133  if x > self.location: return 0.5 + (0.5 * r)
2134  else: return 0.5 - (0.5 * r)
2135 
2136  def PDF(self, x):
2137  """
2138  Partial Distribution Function, which gives the probability for the
2139  particular value of x, or the area under probability distribution
2140  from x-h to x+h for continuous distribution."""
2141  r = math.exp(-1 * abs((x - self.location)/self.scale))
2142  r = r * (abs((x - self.location)/self.scale) ** (self.shape -1))
2143  return r / (2 * self.scale * nrpy.gammln(self.shape))
2144 
2145  def inverseCDF(self, probability, start=0.0, step=0.01):
2146  """
2147  It does the reverse of CDF() method, it takes a probability value
2148  and returns the corresponding value on the x-axis."""
2149  cprob = self.CDF(start)
2150  if probability < cprob: return (start, cprob)
2151  while (probability > cprob):
2152  start = start + step
2153  cprob = self.CDF(start)
2154  # print start, cprob
2155  return (start, cprob)
2156 
2157  def mean(self):
2158  """Gives the arithmetic mean of the sample."""
2159  return self.location
2160 
2161  def skew(self):
2162  """Gives the skew of the sample."""
2163  return 0.0
2164 
2165  def variance(self):
2166  """Gives the variance of the sample."""
2167  return self.shape * (self.shape + 1) * (self.scale ** 2)
2168 
2169  def qmean(self):
2170  """Gives the quantile of the arithmetic mean of the sample."""
2171  return 0.5

2505 class GumbelDistribution(Distribution):
2506  """Class for Gumbel Distribution."""
2507 
2508  def __init__(self, location, scale):
2509  """Constructor method. The parameters are used to construct the
2510  probability distribution.
2511 
2512  @param location: S{eta}
2513  @param scale: S{theta}"""
2514  self.location = location
2515  self.scale = scale
2516 
2517  def CDF(self, x):
2518  """
2519  Cummulative Distribution Function, which gives the cummulative
2520  probability (area under the probability curve) from -infinity or 0 to
2521  a give x-value on the x-axis where y-axis is the probability."""
2522  return math.exp(-1 * math.exp((self.location - x) / self.scale))
2523 
2524  def PDF(self, x):
2525  """
2526  Partial Distribution Function, which gives the probability for the
2527  particular value of x, or the area under probability distribution from
2528  x-h to x+h for continuous distribution."""
2529  return (1/self.scale) * math.exp((self.location - x) / self.scale) * \
2530  self.CDF(x)
2531 
2532  def inverseCDF(self, probability, start=0.0, step=0.01):
2533  """
2534  It does the reverse of CDF() method, it takes a probability value and
2535  returns the corresponding value on the x-axis."""
2536  cprob = self.CDF(start)
2537  if probability < cprob: return (start, cprob)
2538  while (probability > cprob):
2539  start = start + step
2540  cprob = self.CDF(start)
2541  # print start, cprob
2542  return (start, cprob)
2543 
2544  def mean(self):
2545  """Gives the arithmetic mean of the sample."""
2546  return self.location + (GAMMA * self.scale)
2547 
2548  def mode(self):
2549  """Gives the mode of the sample."""
2550  return self.location
2551 
2552  def median(self):
2553  """Gives the median of the sample."""
2554  return self.location - self.scale * math.log10(math.log10(2))
2555 
2556  def kurtosis(self):
2557  """Gives the kurtosis of the sample."""
2558  return 2.4
2559 
2560  def skew(self):
2561  """Gives the skew of the sample."""
2562  return 1.1395
2563 
2564  def variance(self):
2565  """Gives the variance of the sample."""
2566  return 1.667 * ((PI * self.scale) ** 2)
2567 
2568  def quantile1(self):
2569  """Gives the 1st quantile of the sample."""
2570  return self.location - self.scale * math.log10(math.log10(4))
2571 
2572  def quantile3(self):
2573  """Gives the 3rd quantile of the sample."""
2574  return self.location - self.scale * math.log10(math.log10(1.333))
2575 
2576  def qmean(self):
2577  """Gives the quantile of the arithmetic mean of the sample."""
2578  return 0.5704
2579 
2580  def qmode(self):
2581  """Gives the quantile of the mode of the sample."""
2582  return 0.3679
2583 
2584  def random(self, seed):
2585  """Gives a random number based on the distribution."""
2586  while 1:
2587  seed = self.location - \
2588  (self.scale * math.log10(-1 * math.log10(seed)))
2589  yield seed

2592 class HalfNormalDistribution(Distribution):
2593  """
2594  Half Normal distribution is a special case of Chi distribution where
2595  shape (also degrees of freedom) = 1, and Folded Normal distribution
2596  where location = 0
2597  """
2598  def __init__(self, **parameters):
2599  """Constructor method. The parameters are used to construct the
2600  probability distribution."""
2601  try: self.distribution = ChiDistribution(location =
2602  parameters['location'],
2603  scale = parameters['scale'],
2604  shape = 1)
2605  except KeyError:
2606  raise DistributionParameterError('Halfnormal distribution \
2607  requires location and scale parameters')
2608  def CDF(self, x):
2609  """

2645  def __init__(self, location, scale):
2646  """
2647  Constructor method. The parameters are used to construct the
2648  probability distribution.
2649 
2650  @param location:
2651  @param scale:"""
2652  self.location = location
2653  self.scale = scale
2654 
2655  def CDF(self, x):
2656  """
2657  Cummulative Distribution Function, which gives the cummulative
2658  probability (area under the probability curve) from -infinity or 0 to
2659  a give x-value on the x-axis where y-axis is the probability."""
2660  return (2 / PI) * \
2661  (1 / math.tan(math.exp((x - self.location) / self.scale)))

2664  """
2665  Partial Distribution Function, which gives the probability for the
2666  particular value of x, or the area under probability distribution
2667  from x-h to x+h for continuous distribution."""
2668  return (1 / math.cosh((x - self.location) / self.scale)) / \
2669  (PI * math.scale)

2677  while (probability > cprob):
2678  start = start + step
2679  cprob = self.CDF(start)
2680  # print start, cprob
2681  return (start, cprob)

3030 class NegativeBinomialDistribution(Distribution):
3031  """Class for Negative Binomial Distribution."""
3032 
3033  def __init__(self, success, target):
3034  """Constructor method. The parameters are used to construct the
3035  probability distribution.
3036 
3037  @param success: probability of success; 0 <= success <= 1
3038  @param target: a constant, target number of successes"""
3039  self.success = success
3040  self.target = target
3041 
3042  def CDF(self, x):
3043  """
3044  Cummulative Distribution Function, which gives the cummulative
3045  probability (area under the probability curve) from -infinity or 0 to
3046  a give x-value on the x-axis where y-axis is the probability."""
3047  summation = 0.0
3048  for i in range(x): summation = summation + self.PDF(i)
3049  return summation
3050 
3051  def PDF(self, x):
3052  """
3053  Partial Distribution Function, which gives the probability for the
3054  particular value of x, or the area under probability distribution from
3055  x-h to x+h for continuous distribution."""
3056  return nrpy.bico(x - 1, self.target - 1) * \
3057  (self.success ** self.target) * \
3058  ((1 - self.success) ** (x - self.target))
3059 
3060  def inverseCDF(self, probability, start = 0, step = 1):
3061  """
3062  It does the reverse of CDF() method, it takes a probability value and
3063  returns the corresponding value on the x-axis."""
3064  cprob = self.CDF(start)
3065  if probability < cprob: return (start, cprob)
3066  while (probability > cprob):
3067  start = start + step
3068  cprob = self.CDF(start)
3069  # print start, cprob
3070  return (start, cprob)
3071 
3072  def mean(self):
3073  """Gives the arithmetic mean of the sample."""
3074  return self.target / self.success
3075 
3076  def mode(self):
3077  """Gives the mode of the sample."""
3078  return int((self.success + self.target - 1)/self.success)
3079 # def random(self):
3080 # """Gives a random number based on the distribution."""
3081 # raise DistributionFunctionError
3082

3086  Negative-exponential distribution is an alias of Exponential distribution."""
3087  return ExponentialDistribution(**parameters)

3090 class ParetoDistribution(Distribution):
3091  """Class for Pareto Distribution."""
3092 
3093  def __init__(self, location=1.0, scale=1.0):
3094  """Constructor method. The parameters are used to construct the
3095  probability distribution.
3096 
3097  @param location: also the scale; default = 1.0
3098  @param scale: S{lambda}; default = 1.0"""
3099  self.location = location
3100  self.scale = scale
3101 
3102  def CDF(self, x):
3103  """
3104  Cummulative Distribution Function, which gives the cummulative
3105  probability (area under the probability curve) from -infinity or 0 to
3106  a give x-value on the x-axis where y-axis is the probability."""
3107  return 1 - (self.location/x) ** self.scale
3108 
3109  def PDF(self, x):
3110  """
3111  Partial Distribution Function, which gives the probability for the
3112  particular value of x, or the area under probability distribution from
3113  x-h to x+h for continuous distribution."""
3114  return (self.shape * (self.location ** self.scale)) / \
3115  (x ** (self.scale + 1))
3116 
3117  def inverseCDF(self, probability, start=0.0, step=0.01):
3118  """
3119  It does the reverse of CDF() method, it takes a probability value and
3120  returns the corresponding value on the x-axis."""
3121  cprob = self.CDF(start)
3122  if probability < cprob: return (start, cprob)
3123  while (probability > cprob):
3124  start = start + step
3125  cprob = self.CDF(start)
3126  # print start, cprob
3127  return (start, cprob)
3128 
3129  def mean(self):
3130  """Gives the arithmetic mean of the sample."""
3131  return (self.location * self.scale) / (self.scale - 1)
3132 
3133  def mode(self):
3134  """Gives the mode of the sample."""
3135  return self.location
3136 
3137  def median(self):
3138  """Gives the median of the sample."""
3139  return self.location * (2 ** (1/self.scale))
3140 
3141  def kurtosis(self):
3142  """Gives the kurtosis of the sample."""
3143  n = 6 * (self.scale ** 3 + self.scale ** 2 + 6 * self.scale - 2)
3144  d = self.scale * (self.scale ** 2 - 7 * self.scale + 12)
3145  return n/d
3146 
3147  def skew(self):
3148  """Gives the skew of the sample."""
3149  n = 2 * (self.scale + 1) * math.sqrt(self.scale - 2)
3150  d = (self.scale - 3) * math.sqrt(self.scale)
3151  return n/d
3152 
3153  def variance(self):
3154  """Gives the variance of the sample."""
3155  n = (self.location ** 2) * self.scale
3156  d = (self.scale - 2) * ((self.scale - 1) ** 2)
3157  return n/d
3158 
3159  def quantile1(self):
3160  """Gives the 1st quantile of the sample."""
3161  return self.location * (1.333 ** (1/self.scale))
3162 
3163  def quantile3(self):
3164  """Gives the 3rd quantile of the sample."""
3165  return self.location * (4 ** (1/self.scale))
3166 
3167  def qmean(self):
3168  """Gives the quantile of the arithmetic mean of the sample."""
3169  return 1 - (((self.scale - 1) / self.scale) ** self.scale)
3170 
3171  def qmode(self):
3172  """Gives the quantile of the mode of the sample."""
3173  return 0.0
3174 
3175  def random(self):
3176  """Gives a random number based on the distribution."""
3177  return random.paretovariate(self.scale)

3302 class RademacherDistribution(Distribution):
3303  """Class for Rademacher Distribution."""
3304 
3305  def __init__(self):
3306  """Constructor method."""
3307  pass
3308 
3309  def CDF(self, x):
3310  """
3311  Cummulative Distribution Function, which gives the cummulative
3312  probability (area under the probability curve) from -infinity or 0 to
3313  a give x-value on the x-axis where y-axis is the probability."""
3314  if x < -1:
3315  return 0.0
3316  elif x > -1 and x < 1:
3317  return 0.5
3318  else: return 1.0
3319 
3320  def PDF(self, x):
3321  """
3322  Partial Distribution Function, which gives the probability for the
3323  particular value of x, or the area under probability distribution
3324  from x-h to x+h for continuous distribution."""
3325  if x == -1 or x == 1: return 0.5
3326  else: return 0.0
3327 
3328  def inverseCDF(self, probability, start=0.0, step=0.01):
3329  """
3330  It does the reverse of CDF() method, it takes a probability value
3331  and returns the corresponding value on the x-axis."""
3332  if probability == 0.0: return (-1.0001, 0.0)
3333  if probability == 1.0: return (1.0, 1.0)
3334  else: return (0.999, 0.5)
3335 
3336  def mean(self):
3337  """Gives the arithmetic mean of the sample."""
3338  return 0
3339 
3340  def skew(self):
3341  """Gives the skew of the sample."""
3342  return 0
3343 
3344  def variance(self):
3345  """Gives the variance of the sample."""
3346  return 1
